name: Bible
comment:
A library for working with Bible references.


# Parsing

@docs fromString


# Formatting

@docs format


# Encoding

It may be useful to have a unique, compact representation of a reference for storage, searching, sorting, etc.

An easy way to achieve this is to convert the start and end of the reference to an `Int`.
These integers can then be stored in a database, sorted, checked for intersections to do searches, etc.

The encoding process is as follows:

    (1000000 * Book.toInt book) + (1000 * chapter) + verse

This results in an `Int` with the following structure

    16001001
    --===___
     | |  |
     | |  |
     | |  |--- Zero padded verse number
     | |------ Zero padded chapter number
     |-------- Book number

@docs encode, decode


# Lower Level Parts

These functions may be useful if you want to build your own formatter, or something else.

@docs toStartBookString, toEndBookString, toStartChapter, toEndChapter, toStartVerse, toEndVerse


# Types

@docs Reference

unions.name: Reference
unions.comment: An opaque type to represent a Bible reference.

values.name: decode
values.comment: Attempt to convert an encoded value to a reference.
values.type: { start : Basics.Int, end : Basics.Int } -> Result.Result String.String Bible.Reference

values.name: encode
format
values.comment:
Get a formatted `String` from a `Reference`.

Some example outputs:

  - Genesis 1:1
  - Genesis 1:1-11
  - Genesis 1:1 - 12:2
  - Genesis 1:1 - Exodus 2:4

values.name: fromString
values.comment:
Attempt to convert a `String` into a `Reference`.

The following formats should work:

  - Genesis 1
  - Genesis 1:1
  - Genesis 1:1-20
  - Genesis 1:20-2:24
  - Genesis 1-5
  - Genesis 1 - Exodus 5
  - Genesis 1:1 - Exodus 5:20
  - Genesis 1:1 - Exodus 5
  - Genesis 1 - Exodus 5:20

values.name: toEndBookString
values.comment: Get the name of the book the reference ends with.

values.name: toEndChapter
values.comment: Get the chapter the reference ends with.

values.name: toEndVerse
values.comment: Get the verse the reference ends with.

values.name: toStartBookString
values.comment: Get the name of the book the reference starts with.

values.name: toStartChapter
values.comment: Get the chapter the reference starts with.

values.name: toStartVerse
values.comment: Get the verse the reference starts with.
